websocket

Class WebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • websocket.WebSocket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleChatServer, ExampleEchoServer

    public class WebSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple WebSocket server

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebSocket() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Interrupts the threadHandler which tells all the client threads to shut down and closes the ServerSocket
      void connect(int port, int pingTimeout)
      Opens a ServerSocket connection to the specified port and starts ThreadHandler which accepts new client connections

      Opens a ServerSocket connection to the specified port and starts ThreadHandler which accepts new client connections

      Waits for new message in the message queue, and retrieves it when the message arrives
      boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String message)

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebSocket

        public WebSocket()

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(int port,
                    int pingTimeout)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a ServerSocket connection to the specified port and starts ThreadHandler which accepts new client connections
        Parameters:
        port - the port number
        pingTimeout - how often the server will ping the client, in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws exception if ServerSocket is unable to connect

      • connect

        public void connect(int port,
                    int backlog,
                    java.net.InetAddress bindAddress,
                    int pingTimeout)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a ServerSocket connection to the specified port and starts ThreadHandler which accepts new client connections
        Parameters:
        port - the port number
        backlog - requested maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.
        bindAddress - the local InetAddress the server will bind to
        pingTimeout - how often the server will ping the client, in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws exception if ServerSocket is unable to connect

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a string message to all clients
        Parameters:
        message - String text
        Returns:
        false if there are no clients connected otherwise true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error when writing to client

      • recieveMessage

        public java.lang.String recieveMessage()
        Waits for new message in the message queue, and retrieves it when the message arrives
        Returns:
        String message from client message is null if waiting is interrupted

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Interrupts the threadHandler which tells all the client threads to shut down and closes the ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to close ServerSocket
